intro: Cerastium kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
